segment.source: How to Configure Published Applications
segment.target: How to Configure Published Applications

segment.source: How to Configure Published Applications
segment.target: How to Configure Published Applications

segment.source: How to Configure Published Applications
segment.target: How to Configure Published Applications

segment.source: Applications that are not compatible with the host operating system can be run within the MED-V workspace and initiated from within the MED-V workspace the same way they are initiated from the desktop—from the Start menu or from a local host shortcut.
segment.target: Applications that are not compatible with the host operating system can be run within the MED-V workspace and initiated from within the MED-V workspace the same way they are initiated from the desktop—from the Start menu or from a local host shortcut.

segment.source: Applications selected and defined are called published applications.
segment.target: Applications selected and defined are called published applications.

segment.source: The procedures in this section describe how to add and remove published applications.
segment.target: The procedures in this section describe how to add and remove published applications.

segment.source: An application can be published in one of the following ways:
segment.target: An application can be published in one of the following ways:

segment.source: As an application—Select a specific application by typing in the command line for the application.
segment.target: As an application—Select a specific application by typing in the command line for the application.

segment.source: Only the application selected is published.
segment.target: Only the application selected is published.

segment.source: As a menu—Select a folder that contains multiple applications.
segment.target: As a menu—Select a folder that contains multiple applications.

segment.source: All applications within the folder are published and displayed as a menu.
segment.target: All applications within the folder are published and displayed as a menu.

segment.source: How to Add a Published Application to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add a Published Application to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To add an application to the MED-V workspace
segment.target: To add an application to the MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Applications pane, in the Published Applications section, click Add to add a new application.
segment.target: In the Applications pane, in the Published Applications section, click Add to add a new application.

segment.source: Configure the application properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the application properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are setting Internet Explorer as a published application to ensure that Web redirection works properly, make certain that any parameters are not in parentheses.
segment.target: If you are setting Internet Explorer as a published application to ensure that Web redirection works properly, make certain that any parameters are not in parentheses.

segment.source: Published Application Properties
segment.target: Published Application Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Select this check box to enable the published application.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable the published application.

segment.source: Display name
segment.target: Display name

segment.source: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.
segment.target: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The display name is not case sensitive.
segment.target: The display name is not case sensitive.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: A description of the published application, which appears as a tooltip when the user's mouse hovers over the shortcut.
segment.target: A description of the published application, which appears as a tooltip when the user's mouse hovers over the shortcut.

segment.source: Command line
segment.target: Command line

segment.source: The command used to run the application from within the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The command used to run the application from within the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The full path is required, and the parameters can be passed to the application in a similar fashion as in any other Windows command.
segment.target: The full path is required, and the parameters can be passed to the application in a similar fashion as in any other Windows command.

segment.source: In a revertible MED-V workspace, you can map a network drive with MapNetworkDrive syntax: MapNetworkDrive drivepath—for example, MapNetworkDrive t: tux\date.
segment.target: In a revertible MED-V workspace, you can map a network drive with MapNetworkDrive syntax: MapNetworkDrive drivepath—for example, MapNetworkDrive t: tux\date.

segment.source: For example, to publish Windows Explorer, use the following syntax: c:\ or c:\windows.
segment.target: For example, to publish Windows Explorer, use the following syntax: c:\ or c:\windows.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To have a name resolution, you need to perform one of the following:
segment.target: To have a name resolution, you need to perform one of the following:

segment.source: Configure the DNS in the base MED-V workspace image.
segment.target: Configure the DNS in the base MED-V workspace image.

segment.source: Verify the DNS resolution is defined in the host, and configure it to use the host DNS.
segment.target: Verify the DNS resolution is defined in the host, and configure it to use the host DNS.

segment.source: Use the IP for defining the network drive.
segment.target: Use the IP for defining the network drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the path includes spaces, the entire path must be inside quotation marks.
segment.target: If the path includes spaces, the entire path must be inside quotation marks.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The path should not end with a backslash ().
segment.target: The path should not end with a backslash ().

segment.source: Start menu
segment.target: Start menu

segment.source: Select this check box to create a shortcut for the application in the user's Windows Start menu.
segment.target: Select this check box to create a shortcut for the application in the user's Windows Start menu.

segment.source: All published applications appear as shortcuts in the Windows Start menu (Start All Programs MED-V Applications).
segment.target: All published applications appear as shortcuts in the Windows Start menu (Start All Programs MED-V Applications).

segment.source: How to Remove a Published Application from a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Remove a Published Application from a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To remove an application from the MED-V workspace
segment.target: To remove an application from the MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Click a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: In the Applications pane, in the Published Applications section, select an application to remove.
segment.target: In the Applications pane, in the Published Applications section, select an application to remove.

segment.source: Click Remove.
segment.target: Click Remove.

segment.source: The application is removed from the list of published applications.
segment.target: The application is removed from the list of published applications.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: How to Add a Published Menu to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add a Published Menu to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To add a published menu to the MED-V workspace
segment.target: To add a published menu to the MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Applications pane, in the Published Menus section, click Add to add a new menu.
segment.target: In the Applications pane, in the Published Menus section, click Add to add a new menu.

segment.source: Configure the menu properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the menu properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Published Menu Properties
segment.target: Published Menu Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Select this check box to enable the published menu.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable the published menu.

segment.source: Display name
segment.target: Display name

segment.source: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.
segment.target: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: The description, which appears as a tooltip when the user's mouse hovers over the shortcut.
segment.target: The description, which appears as a tooltip when the user's mouse hovers over the shortcut.

segment.source: Folder in workspace
segment.target: Folder in workspace

segment.source: Select the folder to publish as a menu containing all the applications within the folder.
segment.target: Select the folder to publish as a menu containing all the applications within the folder.

segment.source: The text displayed is a relative path from the Programs folder.
segment.target: The text displayed is a relative path from the Programs folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If left blank, all programs on the host will be published as a menu.
segment.target: If left blank, all programs on the host will be published as a menu.

segment.source: All published menus appear as shortcuts in the Windows Start menu (Start All Programs MED-V Applications).
segment.target: All published menus appear as shortcuts in the Windows Start menu (Start All Programs MED-V Applications).

segment.source: You can change the name of the shortcut in the Start-menu shortcuts folder field.
segment.target: You can change the name of the shortcut in the Start-menu shortcuts folder field.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When configuring two MED-V workspaces, it is recommended to configure a different name for the Start menu shortcuts folder.
segment.target: When configuring two MED-V workspaces, it is recommended to configure a different name for the Start menu shortcuts folder.

segment.source: How to Remove a Published Menu from a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Remove a Published Menu from a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To remove a published menu from a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To remove a published menu from a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Click a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: In the Applications pane, in the Published Menus section, select a menu to remove.
segment.target: In the Applications pane, in the Published Menus section, select a menu to remove.

segment.source: Click Remove.
segment.target: Click Remove.

segment.source: The menu is removed from the list of published menus.
segment.target: The menu is removed from the list of published menus.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Running a Published Application from a Command Line on the Client
segment.target: Running a Published Application from a Command Line on the Client

segment.source: The administrator can run published applications from any location, such as a desktop shortcut, using the following command:
segment.target: The administrator can run published applications from any location, such as a desktop shortcut, using the following command:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The MED-V workspace in which the published application is defined must be running.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace in which the published application is defined must be running.
